story.text: NEW YORK Jan 3 The dollar slipped on Wednesday, paring earlier gains after the ADP National Employment Report said that U.S. private sector employment likely posted a surprise decline in December. Private sector jobs likely fell by 40,000 in the month, compared to consensus forecasts for a rise of almost 130,000 jobs. The euro was trading down 0.25 percent on the day at $1.3246 EUR=, compared to around $1.3130 before the release of the data.
story.title: forex - dollar slips after adp says jobs fell in dec
